poem:
**The Great Escape**

In the garden bordered by brick  
where a tortoise dreams of the horizon,  
time's slow architect sketches escape.  
Wary of cloistered freedom,  
I watch his leisurely plotting,  
each step a whisper of rebellion  
against the metric of his shell,  
reminding me how every creature  
harbors some hidden desire  
to break quietly free.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Tim Dowling: the tortoise has been plotting his escape for more than half a century A reader writes, asking how I can let my tortoise roam free in my back garden. She’d like to do the same with her adopted tortoise, but is worried it will escape. I explain that my garden is bounded by high brick walls, safely sealing the tortoise in, but that I too am consumed by fear that he will escape.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
